content.description:
V0 / 0- / downclimb - obvious Juggy line close to the center of the face when approaching the boulder.

 fun moves, especially if you add a sit , crux is a big move up and right to a sneaky jug on a shelf, top out is cruiser, might want a pad if climber is looking to jump off v. down climb
content.location: Center of main obvious face when approching

content.description: Boulder on the right side (headed west/ north) near mile marker 45. about 30-40' off of 302.This boulder has a few nice problems on it, I'm not sure to what extent it has been climbed in the past. there is a v0 That's pretty obvious, a nice juggy arete to the right of it closer to v1, and a longer convoluted problem to the left of the v0 that finishes up the v0.I think there also may be a compression problem around the left side of the boulder.All falls are very clean and its not so tall. I don't believe a pad is necessary, unless you want one. there are some roots but no rocks to fall on, the ground around the routes is relatively soft.
